text: Why Wheat is CD of the Worst Carbs for Your NN Technically speaking , wheat is a grain containing carbohydrates . It makes up most of our noodles and breads that are the source of most carbohydrates in our diet . Modern wheat RB is n’t wheat at all and far from the NN food the wheat industry wants you to VB it is . High - yielding and now genetically modified varieties of wheat are making this CD cereal grain you ’ll probably VB to axe from your food list . So how–and when –did this ancient grain become such a serious NN threat ? Author and preventive cardiologist William Davis , MD , VBZ it ’s when JJ agriculture stepped in decades RB to develop a higher - yielding crop . Today ’s “ wheat , ” he VBZ , is n’t RB wheat , thanks to some of the most intense crossbreeding efforts ever seen . “ The wheat NNS sold to you today are nothing IN the wheat NNS of our grandmother ’s age , very different from the wheat of the early 20th NN , and completely transformed from the wheat of the NNP and earlier , ” he VBZ . Plant breeders changed wheat in dramatic ways . Once more than four NNS tall , modern wheat –the type grown in 99 percent of wheat fields IN the world–is now a stocky CD - NN - tall plant with an unusually JJ seed head . Dr. Davis VBZ accomplishing this involved crossing wheat with non-wheat grasses to introduce altogether JJ genes , using techniques IN irradiation of wheat seeds and embryos with chemicals , gamma rays , and high - dose X - rays to induce mutations . Australian NNS have now revealed serious issues over a JJ kind of genetically engineered wheat that MD induce major NN threats for NNS that consume it . NNP of Canterbury Professor Jack Heinemann announced the outcomes of his genetic NN into the wheat , a kind engineered by NNP ’s Commonwealth Scientific and Industrial Research Organisation ( CSIRO ) . Additional claims came from NNS in NNP to have developed a form of salt - tolerant wheat that MD allow farmers to grow crops in NN with high salinity . Japan ’s flour NNS are RB rejecting GM wheat , echoing consumer opposition . In a statement released today , the Flour Miller ’s Association of Japan wrote to the No! GMO NN indicating its opposition . “ Under the present circumstances , with all the doubts about safety and the environment that the consumers in Japan have , including the effect on the JJ NN from GM foods , GM wheat is included among the items that are not acceptable for the Japanese NN , ” Kadota Masaaki , senior managing director of the Flour Miller ’s Association wrote to the No! GMO NN . The Nutrional Value of Wheat is Practically Non-Existent In Its Current Form So - called NN experts in nutrition who continue to promote the NN benefits of wheat are extremely uninformed about the nature of modern wheat and its evolution from growth to consumption . It is shocking how JJ professionals in JJ NN still recommend wheat NNS without an assessment of their individual requirements , especially considering the amount of evidence regarding its lack of nutrition and NN risks for proportionally JJ segments of the population . The majority of wheat is processed into 60 % extraction , bleached white flour . 60 % extraction –the standard for most wheat NNS means that 40 % of the original wheat grain is removed . So not only do we have an unhealthier , modified , and hybridized strain of wheat , we RB remove and further degrade its nutritional value by processing it . Unfortunately , the 40 % that gets removed includes the bran and the germ of the wheat grain–its most nutrient - rich parts . In the process of making 60 % extraction flour , over half of the vitamin B1 , B2 , B3 , E , folic acid , calcium , phosphorus , zinc , copper , iron , and fiber are lost . Any processed foods with wheat are akin to poison for the NN since they VBP more NN risks than benefits . The NN does not recognize processed wheat as food . Nutrient absorption from processed wheat NNS is thus consequential with almost no nutritional value . Some experts claim if you select 100 % whole wheat NNS , the bran and the germ of the wheat will remain in your meals , and the NN benefits will be impressive . This is again a falsity promoted by the wheat industry since RB 100 % whole wheat NNS are VBN on modern wheat strains created by irradiation of wheat seeds and embryos with chemicals , gamma rays , and high - dose X - rays to induce mutations . Whether you consume 10 % or 100 % of wheat is irrelevant since you ’re still consuming a NN damaging grain that will not benefit , advance or RB maintain your NN in any NN . Dr. Marcia Alvarez who specializes in nutritional programs for obese patients VBZ that when it comes to nutrition , wheat MD be considered as an evil grain . “ Modern wheat grains MD certainly be considered as the root of all evil in the NN of nutrition since they VBP so JJ documented NN problems across so JJ populations in the NN . ” Dr. Alvarez asserted that wheat is now responsible for more intolerances than almost any other food in the NN . “ In my practice of over CD decades , we have documented that for every ten NNS with digestive problems , obesity , irritable bowel syndrome , diabetes , arthritis and RB heart NN , eight out of ten have a problem with wheat . Once we remove wheat from their diets , most of their NNS disappear within three to six months , ” she added . Dr. Alvarez estimates that between the coming influx of genetically modified ( GM ) strains of wheat and the current tendency of wheat elimination in societies , that a trend is emerging in the next 20 NNS that will likely VB 80 % of NNS cease their consumption of wheat from any form . A powerful little chemical in wheat VBN as ‘ wheat germ agglutinin’ ( WGA ) which is largely responsible for JJ of wheat ’s pervasive , and difficult to diagnose , ill effects . NNS are now discovering that WGA in modern wheat is very different from ancient strains . Not only does WGA throw a monkey wrench into our assumptions about the primary causes of wheat intolerance , but due to the fact that WGA is VBN in highest concentrations in “ whole wheat , ” including its supposedly superior sprouted form , it RB pulls the rug out from under CD of the NN food industry ’s favorite poster NNS . Evidence is mounting that a significant percentage of the population is sensitive to gluten . When we eat bread that contains gluten ( wheat , spelt , rye and barley ) , the immune NN in our digestive tract “ attacks ” the gluten proteins . Gluten sensitivity is RB associated with some NNS of schizophrenia and cerebellar ataxia – both serious disorders of the brain . Gluten is probably harmful for most NNS , not just those with diagnosed celiac NN or gluten sensitivity . The only NN to RB VB if you ’re gluten sensitive is to remove gluten from your diet for 30 days and then reintroduce it and VB whether it affects you . Each grain of wheat contains about CD microgram of Wheat Germ Agglutinin ( WGA ) . RB in small quantities , WGA can have profoundly adverse effects . It MD be pro-inflammatory , immunotoxic , cardiotoxic … and neurotoxic . Below the radar of conventional serological testing for antibodies against the various gluten proteins and genetic testing for NN susceptibility , the WGA “ lectin problem ” remains almost entirely obscured . Lectins , though VBN in all grains , seeds , legumes , dairy and our beloved nightshades : the tomato and potato , are rarely discussed in connection with NN or illness , RB when their presence in our diet MD greatly reduce both the quality and length of our lives . Yet NN experts dismiss the links between NN and wheat despite all the evidence . Dr William Davis has documented several hundred JJ studies on the adverse effects of wheat . These are studies that document the neurologic impairments unique to wheat , including cerebellar ataxia and dementia ; heart NN ; visceral fat accumulation and all its attendant NN consequences ; the process of glycation via amylopectin A of wheat that leads to cataracts , diabetes , and arthritis ; among others . There are , in fact , a wealth of studies documenting the adverse , often crippling , effects of wheat consumption in NNS . The other claim is that wheat elimination ‘ means missing out on a wealth of essential nutrients . Another falsity . Dr. Davis VBZ that if you replace wheat with healthy foods IN vegetables , nuts , healthy oils , meats , eggs , cheese , avocados , and olives , then there is no nutrient deficiency that develops with elimination of wheat . Dr Davis RB VBZ that NNS with celiac NN MD require JJ - term supplementation due to extensive gastrointenstinal damage caused by wheat . NNS with celiac NN do indeed experience deficiencies of multiple vitamins and minerals after they eliminate all wheat and gluten from the diet . But this is not due to a diet lacking valuable nutrients , but from the incomplete healing of the gastrointestinal tract ( such as the lining of the duodenum and proximal jejunum ) . In these NNS , the destructive effects of wheat are so overpowering that , unfortunately , some NNS never heal completely . These NNS do indeed require vitamin and mineral supplementation , as well as probiotics and pancreatic enzyme supplementation . Due to the unique properties of amylopectin A , CD slices of whole wheat bread increase NN sugar higher than JJ candy bars . High NN glucose leads to the process of glycation that , in turn , causes arthritis ( cartilage glycation ) , cataracts ( lens NN glycation ) , diabetes ( glycotoxicity of pancreatic beta NNS ) , hepatic de novo lipogenesis that increases triglycerides and , thereby , increases expression of atherogenic ( heart NN - causing ) small LDL particles , leading to heart attacks . Repetitive high NN sugars that develop from a grain - rich diet are , in my view , very destructive and lead to weight gain ( specifically visceral fat ) , insulin resistance , leptin resistance ( leading to obesity ) , and JJ of the NN struggles that JJ now experience . Andrew L. Rubman , ND , is JJ director , Southbury NNP for Traditional Medicines , Southbury , Connecticut , VBD wheat consumption ( specifically gluten VBN in wheat , rye and barley ) MD play a role in turning the genetic diabetes switch to “ on ” for those who carry the NN gene . Dr. Rubman VBZ that gluten avoidance might prove useful for NNS who already havediabetes because it MD reduce the impact of the NN . He suggests to try a gluten - free diet for four to six months to VB if symptom severity and NN sugar NN improve . If the answer is yes , Dr. Rubman advises staying gluten - free for NN . Wheat gliadin has been associated with cerebellar ataxia , peripheral neuropathy , gluten encephalopathy ( dementia ) , behavioral outbursts in NNS with ADHD and NN , and paranoid delusions and auditory hallucinations in NNS with schizophrenia , severe and incapacitating effects for NNS suffering from these conditions . According to statistics from the NNP of Chicago Celiac NNP Center , an average of CD out of every 133 otherwise healthy NNS in the NNP NNPS suffers from CD . However , an estimated 20 - 30 percent of the NN ’s population MD carry the genetic susceptibility to celiac disease–and the NN to avoid turning these genes ‘ on ’ is by avoiding gluten . When you consider that undiagnosed CD is associated with a nearly four - fold increased NN of premature death , the seriousness of this food sensitivity becomes quite evident . The primary NN mechanism at play is chronic inflammation , and chronic inflammatory and degenerative conditions are endemic to grain - consuming populations . Changes in genetic code and , thereby , antigenic profile , of the high - yield semi- dwarf wheat cultivars now on the NN account for the marked increase in celiac potential nationwide . “ Hybridization ” techniques , including chemical mutagenesis to induce selective mutations , leads to NN of unique strains that are not subject to NN or JJ safety testing –they are just brought to NN and sold . Author and preventive cardiologist William Davis , MD , wheat ’s JJ biochemical code causes hormone disruption that is linked to diabetes and obesity . “ It is not my contention that it is in everyone ’s best interest to cut back on wheat ; it is my belief that complete elimination is in everyone ’s best NN interests , ” VBZ Dr. Davis , “ In my view , that ’s how bad this thing called ‘ wheat ’ has become . ” Chemical mutagenesis using the toxic mutagen , sodium azide , of course , is the method VBN to generate BASF ’s Clearfield herbicide - resistant wheat strain . These methods are being VBN on a wide scale to generate unique genetic strains that are , without question from the FDA or USDA , assumed to be safe for JJ consumption . * Note that JJ of the wheat - free options still contain gluten . 1. Cereal Grains : Barley , millet , oats , rice , rye , sorghum , tef and wild rice are all in the same cereal grain family as is wheat . All flours ground from cereal grains MD be VBN as a wheat substitute . Commonly available are barley , buckwheat , rice and rye flour . The less utilized flours MD be purchased RB or from natural food NNS . Note : NNS with a gluten allergy must RB avoid barley , oats and rye . 2. Non-Cereal Grains : Amaranth , quinoa and buckwheat are three grain - IN seeds unrelated to cereal grains . ( Despite its name , buckwheat is not a wheat - relative . ) It is rare for anyone to develop a sensitivity to these non-cereal grains . Amaranth , quinoa and buckwheat are gluten - free and therefore not suitable for making leavened bread ; however , they VBP excellent quick breads and cookies . 3. Nut Meal : Ground nuts such as almonds , hazelnuts or walnuts VBP the richest flour substitute for cookies and cakes . Because their fragile fatty acid content gives them a brief shelf NN , it ’s preferable to grind your own nuts in a food processor just prior to NN . Nut meal requires a binding agent such as eggs . Because chestnuts are lower in fat than other nuts , chestnut flour has a longer shelf NN . It is available RB . 4. Bean Flour : Dried beans , such as navy , pinto and chickpeas MD be milled and VBN , in combination with other flours , as a wheat alternative . Bean flour is , however , not always recommended . It tastes IN beans and makes baked goods dense and hard to digest . 5. Other Flour Substitutes : Potato starch , arrowroot powder , and tapioca are thickening agents that substitute for wheat in sauces and gravy . In baked goods these starchy ingredients serve as a binding agent . Due to the irresponsible high frequency hybridization , processing and inevitable genetic modification of modern wheat , there is only CD solution for the NN and wellness of future generations . Stop eating wheat and educate as JJ NNS as you can on the coming strains of this grain which will be much more deadly than they already are today . Natasha Longo has a master ’s degree in nutrition and is a certified fitness and nutritional counselor . How did the videographer VB so close to the NN without disturbing it ? What was the outcome of this event ? Did the NNP just VB up and run away , or turn to attack the cameraman ? Why has it taken eight NNS for this to be shown ? Why ca n’t the NN VB the rest of the footage ? Ketchum has felt that the scientific community tried to prevent her work from seeing the light of day . “ We encountered the worst scientific bias in the peer review process in recent history , ” Ketchum wrote on her NNP Genome Project NN . “ Several journals MD n’t RB read our manuscript when we sent them a pre-submission inquiry . We were RB mocked by CD reviewer in his peer review . We did finally pass peer review with a relatively JJ journal , ” she wrote . Over the past week , some have alleged that Ketchum somehow “ purchased ” a little - VBN journal in order to re-register it under a JJ name — DeNovo Scientific Journal — and then publish her own results of over 111 samples of reported NN hair , NN , toenail , saliva and NN . “ I ’m certainly not ruling out the possibility that there was a NN of sorts , or a concerted effort to not give this a fair shake , given the controversial matter , ” VBD Idaho NNP NNP anthropologist Jeff Meldrum , a leading academic and recognized scientific authority on NNP . “ To VB an end - run IN the process by erecting a facade in the form of a so - called JJ journal and allege that it is edited and reviewed , without providing any of that information on the JJ web page , it appears that she has undertaken an effort to self - publish , just to VB it out there , ” Meldrum told The Huffington Post . “ And , to boot , she ’s charging $ 30 a pop for a copy of the paper . ” Meldrum VBD he does n’t VB any credible scientific journal MD shy away from the topic simply because of its controversial nature . “ I MD n’t rule it out entirely . There are certainly politics involved in the selection of papers . If it ’s solid work , this is the discovery of the NN , if not the millennium , ” Meldrum VBD . “ Any journal , if they were confident in the results and in the expertise of their reviewers , and it came down positive — I MD VB they MD clamor for the opportunity to have that on the front cover of their journal . ” While this drama was played out in the NN , other related NNP DNA stories quietly emerged . text: Continued from Part 1/3 RB here at The Daily NNP ! As covered in Part 1 of this trilogy of articles , after NNS of questioning and research , I just attended my JJ UFO confab , the 31st Annual 2018 Ozark Mountain UFO Conference in Eureka Springs , Arkansas from April 12 - 14 . After Richard Dolan shared his views about “ UFOs and the NN : Disinformation or Disclosure ? ” the second presenter , astronomer Marc D’Antonio talked about “ Exoplanets and Alien NNP : What We VBP … ” which was a very down - to - NN – so to speak – explanation of how NN NNS VBP wavelengths of light to classify other planets . The tie -in to ufology is where visiting ETs ( extraterrestrials ) might hail from . Since we VBP that all suns are born and eventually die , wiping out planets in their systems , D’Antonio posed the interesting NN that ETs are here because their home planets were destroyed . It is worth mentioning that D’Antonio began his presentation by wondering if owls , which are often associated with UFO sighting and abduction NNS , are screen images of gray aliens ? JJ abductees report remembering JJ images after missing NN , only to find out later that the ETs had imprinted the other image ( owl ) to mask or screen the abductee ’s shocking experience . But D’Antonio ’s exciting NN regarded his roving Humvee with telescopes mounted to it which can VB ultraviolet to infrared ( RB to short wavelengths ) , beyond the light spectrum visible to NNS . Now the search for NNP can VB just about anywhere and record remote images of what is VBG on in the sky . For astronomers , this is exciting stuff . D’Antonio finished with a NNP Bang by unwinding a spool of “ toilet paper ” IN the audience to illustrate how most of NN on NN has appeared over lengthy NN periods – except us NNS , which have been IN NNP for a tiny sliver of the last sheet on the oversized paper roll : Next up was my personal journalistic hero and editor of Earthfiles , ace reporter , author , and television producer , the award - winning Linda Moulton Howe who led us on a ufological tour - de - force titled “ JJ Whistleblower Revelations about UFOs and an Alien Presence . ” Howe broke the story on bloodless cattle mutilations in the late 1980s and has been an avid researcher on All Things UFO since then . She told us this was her 30th appearance in Eureka Springs – out of 31 total conferences ! Here are the highlights of her fascinating narrative : – UFOs have been kept secret since British Prime Minister Winston Churchill told US NNP Harry Truman it had to be that NN or civilization MD crumble . UFOs posed an existential threat to humanity – they MD wipe us out if they so chose – so why panic the NN ? – The JJ NN from Antarctica is that the US NN has , for the past 15 NNS , been removing 13 - 33 CD - NN - JJ artifacts VBN CD and a half NNS below the NN . The NN is accessible only by submarine , and recent visits from NN leaders have something to do with the alien culture which originated these objects – whatever they are . The US NN wants to “ sanitize this physical evidence before presenting it to the NN . ” – The US NN now has the ability to monitor JJ brain patterns from satellite platforms . Howe VBD CD of her NNP sources told her , “ Your every breath is being tracked by the NNPS in Black . ” – A Japanese test of AI ( artificial intelligence ) robots using thought NN as a weapon went horribly wrong when 29 NNS were killed before all four robots MD be deactivated . NNS disabled CD of the robots , but the third began to repair them . The fourth robot reconnected itself to an orbiting satellite to repair itself . This is bad NN , and Howe quoted genius inventor and CEO of Exploration Technologies ( SpaceX ) Elon Musk as saying that NNS need to contain AI via legislation and regulation within the next four NNS or face the possibility that they MD become truly autonomous and become another existential threat . Musk VBD , “ AI is a fundamental NN to humankind . ” – Ironically , Musk is developing his own AI JJ NN , Neuralink , to develop bionic technologies “ for JJ enhancement . ” Coincidentally , he predicts that his NN will link JJ thought to AI devices in four NNS ( there ’s that number again ) . Computer - driven biological NN part replacement is under rapid NN . Soon , we MD be able to VB out a hand ( or a liver ) as easily as replacing the wheels or radiator on a car . – Howe concluded her remarks with a detailed analysis of an alleged briefing held March 6 - 8 , 1981 for newly - elected NNP Ronald Reagan . Then - NNP Director William Colby and a NN of NNP analysts and handlers gave the Commander - in - Chief “ need to VB ” intel about UFOs and ETs . Of the several NNS VBN at that NN , some were helpful , some neutral , and some adversarial . Reagan was especially interested to VB more about the most dangerous of the Hostile Alien Visitors ( HAVs ) , a race called the Trantaloids . Howe posed CD intriguing questions we can all ponder : 2. MD EBENs ( ETs ) save us if a killer asteroid were threatening NN on NNP with an extinction - level event IN the NN that killed all the dinosaurs ? The Visitors have technology advanced enough to destroy such an asteroid – but MD they VB a poor NN out ? The last presenter that JJ day was the “ father of modern ufology , ” nuclear scientist Stanton Friedman . This scholarly physicist explained the nuts - and - bolts of actual nuclear fission and fusion research and NN projects he participated in – most of which , he laughed , lost funding along the NN . The upside to short - lived projects was that Friedman became involved in a multitude of interesting NN and weapons projects – and he had the slides to prove it . Friedman maintains that both black and white operations have produced nuclear technologies capable of NN exploration . In a casual discussion at his book table ( absent his books which were in luggage lost in transit – IN so JJ of his projects , as he quipped – and delivered by the airline only on the last day of the conference , all of which promptly sold out ) , Friedman gave this sage piece of advice : “ Check your facts before you publish – because your critics will . ” Day 2 of the 2018 Ozark Mountain UFO Conference began , for me , with an engrossing talk on subjects I VBP almost nothing about : cryptozoology . Cryptozoologists seek to prove the existence of folkloric entities IN NNP and the Loch Ness Monster . Ufologist , History Channel program regular , and best - selling author , British - born < http://nickredfernfortean.blogspot.com/”> Nicholas “ Nick ” Redfern kept us spell - bound with “ The NNS and NNPS in Black : Do n’t Answer the Door ! ” Redfern traced the JJ report of a NNP in Black to Wales in 1909 . Residents witnessed strange “ balls of light ” overhead – UFOs . Oddly enough , after the incident , a NN dressed completely in black with a distinctive , brimmed hat drove a horse - and - carriage into town . The mysterious figure went from NN to NN , warning the occupants to keep quiet about what they had seen . Over the NNS , stories have circulated about NNS ( both NNS and NNS ) dressed in black , with black hair and often piercing black eyes showing up on experiencers ’ doorsteps – in broad daylight or the middle of the night . They never demand entry . Instead , they ask to be let in , using mind NN techniques . This is something you definitely do not VB to do : resist the urge to open that door . NNS who got close to the MIBs felt nauseous , drained of NN force , and sometimes felt IN their minds were being probed telepathically . Then , Redfern explored the possibility that Ouija boards open a portal to paranormal realms , particularly unsavory ( malefic or downright demonic ) ones . It turns out that Redfern is an expert on Mothman sightings , and he spent quite a bit of NN talking about the Slender NNP phenomenon . Slender NNP was a completely fictional character which won a Most Menacing Monster contest . The tall , faceless NN became very popular among horror fans , to the point where some claimed to have experienced encounters with an actual Slender NN . MD enough mass thought / belief actually create a brand - JJ paranormal enemy – from a potent thought - form ? I certainly had a lot to ponder , with some stellar speakers still to come ! Please join me for ( with a nod to Paul Harvey ) “ the rest of the story . ” To Be Continued in Part 3/3 RB here at The Daily NNP !

text: Jason Statham is an English actor who broke into NN with 1998's ‘ Lock , Stock , and CD Smoking Barrels ’ and later starred in high - profile action movie franchises , including ‘ The Transporter , ’ ‘ Crank , ’ ‘ The Expendables ’ and ‘ The Fast and the Furious . ’ English action star Jason Statham has convincingly portrayed a host of unsavory , yet oddly endearing , tough guys ( hit NNS , thieves , con NNS , assassins , super spies and bodyguards ) who can generally be counted on to dish out beat downs and lead car chases while intercutting the action with a well - timed quip . But before he ever stepped NN on a movie set , Statham ’s NN was just as colorful as the characters he ’s played onscreen . From being an Olympic diver to fashion NN to RB having a side gig in the black NN , Statham amassed a unique set of skills that perfectly positioned him to be an action star . text: As the Official Story of the 1980 October Surprise NN crumbles — with JJ revelations that key evidence was hidden from investigators of a congressional task force and that internal doubts were suppressed — history must finally confront the troubling impression that remains : that disgruntled elements of the NNP and Israel ’s Likud hardliners teamed up to remove a U.S. NN from office . Indeed , it is this disturbing conclusion — perhaps RB more than the idea of a Republican dirty trick — that MD explain the longstanding and determined cover - up of this political scandal . Too JJ powerful interests do not VB the JJ NNS to accept RB the possibility that U.S. intelligence operatives and a longtime ally MD intervene to oust a NN who had impinged on what those CD groups considered their vital interests . To accept that scenario MD mean that CD of the great fears of JJ democracy had come true — George Washington ’s warning against the dangers of “ entangling alliances ” and Harry Truman ’s concern that the clandestine operations of the NNP had the makings of an “ JJ Gestapo . ” It is far easier to assure the JJ NNS that no such thing MD occur , that Israel ’s Likud — whatever its differences with Washington over Middle East peace policies — MD never seek to subvert a U.S. NN , and that NNP dissidents — no matter how frustrated by political constraints — MD never sabotage their own NN . But the evidence points in that direction , and there are some points that are not in dispute . For instance , there is no doubt that NNP NNP Boys and Likudniks had strong motives for seeking NNP Jimmy Carter ’s defeat in 1980 . Inside the NNP , Carter and his NNP Director Stansfield Turner were blamed for firing JJ of the free - wheeling covert operatives from the Vietnam era , for ousting legendary spymaster Ted Shackley , and for failing to protect longtime U.S. allies ( and friends of the NNP ) , such as Iran ’s Shah and Nicaragua ’s dictator Anastasio Somoza . As for Israel , Likud Prime Minister Menachem Begin was furious over Carter ’s high - handed actions at Camp David in 1978 forcing Israel to trade the occupied Sinai to Egypt for a peace deal . Begin feared that Carter MD VB his second term to bully Israel into accepting a Palestinian NN on West Bank lands that Likud considered part of Israel ’s divinely granted territory . JJ Mossad and Foreign Ministry official David Kimche described Begin ’s attitude in his 1991 book , The Last Option , saying that Israeli officials had gotten wind of “ collusion ” between Carter and Egyptian NNP Anwar Sadat “ to force Israel to abandon her refusal to withdraw from territories occupied in 1967 , including Jerusalem , and to agree to the establishment of a Palestinian NN . ” Kimche continued , “ This plan — prepared behind Israel ’s back and without her knowledge — must rank as a unique attempt in NNP NNPS ’s diplomatic history of short - changing a friend and ally by deceit and manipulation . ” However , Begin recognized that the scheme required Carter winning a second term in 1980 when , Kimche wrote , “ he MD be free to compel Israel to accept a settlement of the Palestinian problem on his and Egyptian terms , without having to fear the backlash of the JJ Jewish lobby . ” In his 1992 memoir , Profits of NNP , Ari Ben-Menashe , an Israeli JJ intelligence officer who worked with Likud , agreed that Begin and other Likud leaders held Carter in contempt . “ Begin loathed Carter for the peace agreement forced upon him at Camp David , ” Ben-Menashe wrote . “ As Begin saw it , the agreement took away Sinai from Israel , did not create a comprehensive peace , and left the Palestinian issue hanging on Israel ’s back . ” So , in order to buy NN for Israel to “ VB the facts on the ground ” by moving Jewish settlers into the West Bank , Begin felt Carter ’s reelection had to be prevented . A different NN RB presumably MD give Israel a freer hand to deal with problems on its northern border with Lebanon . As for the NNP NNP Boys , legendary NNP officer NNP Copeland told me that “ the NNP within the NNP ” — the inner-most circle of powerful intelligence figures who felt they understood best the strategic needs of the NNP NNPS — believed Carter and his naïve faith in JJ democratic ideals represented a grave threat to the nation . “ Carter RB believed in all the principles that we talk about in the West , ” Copeland VBD , shaking his mane of white hair . “ As smart as Carter is , he did VB in Mom , apple pie and the corner NN NN . And those things that are good in NNP are good everywhere else . … “ Carter , I VBP , was not a stupid NN , ” Copeland VBD , adding that Carter had an RB worse flaw : “ He was a principled NN . ” These attitudes of “ the NNP within the NNP ” and the Likudniks appear to stem from their genuine beliefs that they needed to protect what they regarded as vital interests of their respective NNS . The NNP NNP Boys thought they understood the true strategic needs of the NNP NNPS and Likud believed fervently in a “ Greater Israel . ” However , the lingering October Surprise mystery is whether these CD groups followed their strongly held feelings into a treacherous bid , in NN with Republicans , to prevent Carter from gaining the release of 52 hostages then held in Iran and thus torpedoing his reelection hopes . Carter ’s inability to resolve that hostage NN did set the stage for Ronald Reagan ’s landslide victory in November 1980 as JJ voters reacted to the JJ - running hostage humiliation by turning to a candidate they believed MD be a tougher player on the international stage . Reagan ’s macho image was reinforced when the Iranians released the hostages immediately after he was inaugurated on Jan. 20 , 1981 , ending the 444 - day standoff . The coincidence of timing , which Reagan ’s supporters cited as proof that foreign enemies feared the JJ NN , gave momentum to Reagan ’s larger agenda , including sweeping NN cuts tilted toward the wealthy , reduced NN regulation of corporations , and renewed reliance on fossil fuels . ( Carter ’s solar panels were pointedly dismantled from the White NNP roof . ) Reagan ’s victory RB was great NN for NNP cold - warriors who were rewarded with the choice of NNP NNP II spymaster ( and dedicated cold - warrior ) William Casey to be NNP director . Casey then purged NNP analysts who were detecting a declining Soviet Union that desired détente and replaced them with NNS IN the JJ and ambitious Robert NNP , who agreed that the Soviets were on the march and that the NNP NNPS needed a massive JJ expansion to counter them . Further , Casey again embraced JJ - NN NNP swashbuckling in Third NNP NNS and took pleasure in misleading or bullying members of Congress when they insisted on the NNP oversight that had been forced on NNP Gerald Ford and had been accepted by NNP Carter . To Casey , NNP oversight became a NN of hide and seek . As for Israel , Begin was pleased to find the Reagan administration far less demanding about peace deals with the Arabs , giving Israel NN to expand its West Bank settlements . Reagan and his NN RB acquiesced to Israel ’s invasion of Lebanon in 1982 , a drive NN that expelled the Palestine Liberation Organization but RB led to the slaughters at the Sabra and Shatila refugee camps . And , behind the scenes , Reagan gave a JJ light to Israeli weapons shipments to Iran ( which was fighting a NN with Israel ’s greater enemy , Iraq ) . The weapons NNS helped Israel rebuild its contacts inside Iran and to turn JJ profits , which were then VBN to VB finance West Bank settlements . In another important move , Reagan credentialed a JJ generation of pro-Israeli JJ ideologues VBN as the neoconservatives , a move that MD pay JJ dividends for Israel in the future as these bright and articulate operatives fought for Israeli interests both inside the U.S. NN and through their opinion - leading roles in the major JJ NN NN . In other words , if the disgruntled NNP NNP Boys and the determined Likudniks did participate in an October Surprise scheme to unseat Jimmy Carter , they surely got much of what they were after . Yet , while motive is an important element in solving a mystery , it does not constitute proof by itself . What must be examined is whether there is evidence that the motive was acted upon , whether Menachem Begin ’s NN and disgruntled NNP officers covertly assisted the Reagan - Bush NN in contacting Iranian officials to thwart Carter ’s hostage negotiations . On that point the evidence is strong though perhaps not ironclad . Still , a well - supported narrative does exist describing how the October Surprise scheme MD have gone down with the NN of NNP personnel , Begin ’s NN , some JJ - wing intelligence figures in Europe , and a handful of other NN brokers in the NNP NNPS . RB before Iran took the JJ hostages on Nov. 4 , 1979 , disgruntled NNP veterans had been lining up behind the presidential candidacy of their JJ boss , George H.W. Bush . Casting off their traditional cloak of non-partisanship and anonymity , they were volunteering as NN soldiers in Bush ’s NN . CD joke about Bush ’s announcement of his candidacy on NNP 1 , 1979 , was that “ half the audience was wearing raincoats . ” Bill Colby , Bush ’s predecessor as NNP director , VBD Bush “ had a flood of NNS from the NNP who joined his supporters . They were retirees devoted to him for what he had done ” in defending the spy agency in 1976 when the NNP came under heavy criticism for spying on Americans , assassination plots and other abuses . Reagan ’s foreign policy adviser Richard Allen described the group working on the Bush NN as a “ plane load of disgruntled JJ NNP ” officers who were “ playing cops and robbers . ” All told , at least CD dozen JJ NNP officials went to work for Bush . Among them was the NNP ’s director of security , Robert Gambino , who joined the Bush NN immediately after leaving the NNP where he oversaw security investigations of senior Carter officials and thus knew about potentially damaging personal information . Besides the ex-CIA personnel who joined the Bush NN , other pro-Bush intelligence officers remained inside the NNP while making clear their political preference . “ The seventh floor of Langley was plastered with ‘ Bush for NNP ’ signs , ” VBD senior NNP analyst George Carver , referring to the floor that housed senior NNP officials . Carter administration officials RB grew concerned about the deep personal ties between the JJ NNP officers in Bush ’s NN and active - duty NNP personnel who continued to hold sensitive jobs under Carter . For instance , Gambino , the 25 - NN NNP veteran who oversaw personnel security checks , and NNP officer Donald Gregg , who served as a NNP representative on Carter ’s National Security Council , “ are good friends who knew each other from the NNP , ” according to an unpublished part of a report by a NNP task force that investigated the October Surprise issue in 1992 . [ I VBD this deleted section — still marked “ secret ” — in unpublished task force files in 1994 . ] Perhaps most significantly , Bush quietly enlisted Theodore Shackley , the legendary NNP covert operations specialist VBN as the “ blond ghost . ” During the Cold NNP , Shackley had run JJ of the NNP ’s most controversial paramilitary operations , from Vietnam and Laos to the JMWAVE operations against Fidel Castro ’s Cuba . In those operations , Shackley had supervised the work of hundreds of NNP officers and developed powerful bonds of loyalty with JJ of his subordinates . For instance , Donald Gregg had served under Shackley ’s command in Vietnam . When Bush was NNP director in 1976 , he appointed Shackley to a top clandestine job , associate deputy director for operations , laying the foundation for Shackley ’s possible rise to director and cementing Shackley ’s loyalty to Bush . When Shackley had a falling out with Carter ’s NNP Director Turner in 1979 , Shackley quit the agency . Privately , Shackley believed that Turner had devastated the agency by pushing out hundreds of covert officers , JJ of them Shackley ’s JJ subordinates . By early 1980 , the Republicans RB were complaining that they were being kept in the dark about progress on the Iran hostage negotiations . George Cave , then a top NNP specialist on Iran , told me that the “ Democrats never briefed the Republicans ” on sensitive developments , creating suspicions among the Republicans . So , the Republicans sought out their own sources of information regarding the hostage NN . Shackley began monitoring Carter ’s progress on negotiations through his contacts with Iranians in Europe , Cave VBD . “ Ted , I VBP , had a couple of contacts in Germany , ” VBD Cave . “ I VBP he talked to them . I do n’t VB how far it went . … Ted was very active on that thing in the winter / spring of 1980 . ” Author David Corn RB got wind of the Shackley - Bush connection when he was researching his biography of Shackley , Blond Ghost . “ Within the spook NN the belief spread that Shackley was close to Bush , ” Corn wrote . “ Rafael Quintero [ an anti-Castro Cuban with close ties to the NNP ] was saying that Shackley met with Bush every week . He told CD associate that should Reagan and Bush triumph , Shackley was considered a potential DCI , ” the abbreviation for NNP director . Some of the legendary NNP officers from an RB earlier generation , those who had helped overthrow Iran ’s elected NN in 1953 and put the Shah on the Peacock Throne , RB injected themselves into the hostage NN . NNP Copeland , CD of the agency ’s JJ Middle East hands , claimed in his memoir , The NNP Player , that he and his NNP chums pondered their own hostage rescue plan while organizing an informal support group for the Bush NN , called “ Spooks for Bush . ” In a 1990 interview , Copeland told me that “ the NN we saw Washington at that NN was that the struggle was RB not between the Left and the NNP , the liberals and the conservatives , as between the Utopians and the realists , the pragmatists . “ Carter was a Utopian . He believed , honestly , that you must do the JJ thing and take your chance on the consequences . He told me that . He literally believed that . ” Copeland ’s deep Southern accent spit out the words with a mixture of amazement and disgust . Copeland ’s contacts at the NN included NNP veteran Archibald Roosevelt and JJ Secretary of NNP Henry Kissinger — both of whom were close to David Rockefeller whose Chase Manhattan Bank handled billions of dollars in the Shah ’s accounts , a fortune that the Iranian mullahs wanted to lay their hands on . “ There were JJ of us — myself along with Henry Kissinger , David Rockefeller , Archie Roosevelt in the NNP at the NN — we believed very strongly that we were showing a kind of weakness , which NNS in Iran and elsewhere in the NN hold in great contempt , ” Copeland VBD . As Copeland and his friends contemplated what to do regarding the hostage NN , he reached out to other of his JJ NNP buddies . According to The NNP Player , Copeland turned to ex-CIA counter - intelligence chief James Angleton . The famed spy hunter “ brought to lunch a Mossad chap who confided that his service had identified at least half of the ‘ students , ’ RB to the extent of having their home addresses in Tehran , ” Copeland wrote . “ He gave me a rundown on what sort of kids they were . Most of them , he VBD , were just that , kids . ” CD of the JJ Israeli intelligence agents assigned to the task of figuring out who was who in the JJ Iranian NN structure was Ari Ben-Menashe , who was born in Iran but emigrated to Israel as a teen - ager . Not only did he speak fluent Farsi , but he had school friends who were rising within the JJ revolutionary bureaucracy . In his memoir , Profits of NNP , Ben-Menashe offered his own depiction of Copeland ’s initiative . Though Copeland was generally regarded as a NNP “ Arabist ” who had opposed Israeli interests in the past , he was admired for his analytical skills , Ben-Menashe wrote . “ A meeting between NNP Copeland and Israeli intelligence officers was held at a Georgetown NN in Washington , D.C. , ” Ben-Menashe wrote . “ The Israelis were happy to deal with any initiative but Carter’s . “ David Kimche , chief of Tevel , the foreign relations unit of Mossad , was the senior Israeli at the meeting . … The Israelis and the Copeland group came up with a CD - pronged plan to VB quiet diplomacy with the Iranians and to draw up a scheme for JJ action against Iran that MD not jeopardize the lives of the hostages . ” In late February 1980 , Seyeed Mehdi Kashani , an Iranian emissary , arrived in Israel to discuss Iran ’s growing desperation for spare parts for its U.S. - supplied NN force , Ben-Menashe wrote . Kashani , whom Ben-Menashe had VBN from their school days in Tehran , RB revealed that the Copeland initiative was making inroads inside Iran and that approaches from some Republican emissaries had already been received , Ben-Menashe wrote . “ Kashani VBD that the secret ex-CIA - NNP - Copeland group was aware that any deal cut with the Iranians MD have to include the Israelis because they MD have to be VBN as a third party to sell JJ equipment to Iran , ” according to Ben-Menashe . In March 1980 , the following month , the Israelis made their JJ direct JJ shipment to Iran , 300 tires for Iran ’s F - 4 fighter jets , Ben-Menashe wrote . Ben-Menashe ’s account of these early Israeli arms shipments was corroborated by Carter ’s press secretary Jody Powell and Israeli arms dealer William Northrop . In an interview for a 1991 PBS “ Frontline ” documentary , Jody Powell told me that “ there had been a rather tense discussion between NNP Carter and Prime Minister Begin in the spring of 1980 in which the NNP made clear that the Israelis had to stop that [ arms dealing ] , and that we knew that they were doing it , and that we MD not allow it to continue , at least not allow it to continue privately and without the knowledge of the JJ NNS . ” “ And it stopped , ” Powell VBD . At least , it stopped temporarily . Meanwhile , Carter RB was learning that Begin was siding with the Republicans . Questioned by congressional investigators in 1992 , Carter VBD he realized by April 1980 that “ Israel cast their lot with Reagan , ” according to notes I VBD among the unpublished documents in the files of a NNP task force that had looked into the October Surprise NN . Carter traced the Israeli opposition to his reelection to a “ lingering concern [ among ] Jewish leaders that I was too friendly with Arabs . ” The NNP RB MD have had political enemies close to his inner circle . Jamshid Hashemi , an Iranian businessman who was recruited by the NNP in January 1980 along with his brother Cyrus , VBD that in spring 1980 , he encountered Donald Gregg , the NNP officer serving on Carter ’s National Security Council staff , at Cyrus ’s Manhattan office . Jamshid Hashemi VBD his brother Cyrus was playing a double NN , officially helping the Carter administration on the hostage NN but privately collaborating with the Republicans . [ For details , VB Robert Parry ’s Secrecy & Privilege . ] The alleged involvement of Gregg is another highly controversial part of the October Surprise mystery . A tall NN with an easy - VBG manner , Gregg had VBN George H.W. Bush since 1967 when Bush was a JJ - term U.S. congressman . Gregg RB briefed Bush when he was U.S. envoy to China . Gregg served , too , as the NNP ’s liaison to the Pike Committee investigation when Bush was NNP director . “ Although Gregg was uniformly regarded as a competent professional , there was a dimension to his background that was entirely unknown to his colleagues at the White NNP , and that was his acquaintance with CD of the Republican frontrunners , George Bush , ” JJ Carter NSC official Gary Sick wrote in his book October Surprise . As the Iran NN dragged on , Copeland and his group of NNP NNP Boys forwarded their own plan for freeing the hostages . However , to Copeland ’s chagrin , his plan fell on deaf ears inside the Carter administration , which was developing its own rescue operation . So , Copeland told me that he distributed his plan outside the administration , to leading Republicans , giving sharper focus to their contempt for Carter ’s bungled Iranian strategy . “ Officially , the plan went only to NNS in the NN and was top secret and all that , ” Copeland VBD . “ But as so often happens in NN , PRP wants support , and when it was not being handled by the Carter administration as though it was top secret , it was handled as though it was nothing . … Yes , I sent copies to everybody who I thought MD be a good ally . … “ Now I ’m not at liberty to VB what reaction , if any , ex-President [ Richard ] Nixon took , but he certainly had a copy of this . We sent CD to Henry Kissinger . … So we had these informal relationships where the little closed circle of NNS who were , a , looking forward to a Republican NNP within a short while and , b , who were absolutely trustworthy and who understood all these inner workings of the international NN board . ” Encircled by a growing legion of enemies , the Carter administration put the finishing touches on its hostage - rescue operation in April . Code - named “ Eagle Claw , ” the assault involved a force of U.S. helicopters that MD swoop down on Tehran , coordinate with some agents on the ground and extract the hostages . Carter ordered the operation to proceed on April 24 , but mechanical problems forced the helicopters to turn back . At a staging area called Desert CD , CD of the helicopters collided with a refueling plane , causing an explosion that killed eight JJ crewmen . Their charred bodies were then displayed by the Iranian NN , adding to the fury and humiliation of the NNP NNPS . After the Desert CD fiasco , the Iranians dispersed the hostages to a variety of locations , effectively shutting the door on another rescue attempt . By summer 1980 , Copeland told me , the Republicans in his circle considered a second hostage - rescue attempt not only unfeasible , but unnecessary . They were talking confidently about the hostages being freed after a Republican victory in November , the JJ NNP NN VBD . “ Nixon , IN everybody else , knew that all we had to do was wait until the NN came , and they were VBG to VB out , ” Copeland VBD . “ That was sort of an open secret among NNS in the intelligence community , that that MD happen . … The intelligence community certainly had some understanding with somebody in Iran in authority , in a NN that they MD hardly confide in me . ” Copeland VBD his NNP friends had been told by contacts in Iran that the mullahs MD do nothing to VB Carter or his reelection . “ At that NN , we had word back , because you always have informed relations with the devil , ” Copeland VBD . “ But we had word that , ‘ Do n’t worry . ’ As RB as Carter MD n’t VB credit for getting these NNS out , as soon as Reagan came in , the Iranians MD be happy enough to wash their hands of this and move into a JJ era of Iranian - JJ relations , whatever that turned out to be . ” In the interview , Copeland declined to give more details , beyond his assurance that “ the NNP within the NNP , ” his term for the true protectors of U.S. national security , had an understanding with the Iranians about the hostages . ( Copeland died on Jan. 14 , 1991 . ) In summer 1980 , Ronald Reagan wrapped up the Republican nomination and offered the vice presidential slot to his JJ rival , George H.W. Bush . As Bush ’s NN merged with Reagan ’s NN , so too did Bush ’s contingent of NNP veterans . Reagan ’s NN director William Casey — a spymaster for the NNP NNP II - era Office of Strategic Services — RB blended in well with the ex-intelligence officers . JJ of the October Surprise allegations have Casey and his longtime business associate John Shaheen , another OSS veteran , meeting with Iranians and other foreigners overseas . Casey RB had secret meetings with Kissinger , according to Casey ’s chauffeur , and with banker David Rockefeller and ex-CIA officer Archibald Roosevelt , who had gone to work for Rockefeller , according to the Sept. 11 , 1980 , visitor log at the Reagan - Bush headquarters in Arlington , Virginia . On Sept. 16 , 1980 , five days after the Rockefeller group ’s visit to Casey ’s office , Iran ’s acting foreign minister Sadegh Ghotbzadeh spoke publicly about Republican interference . “ Reagan , supported by Kissinger and others , has no intention of resolving the problem ” with the hostages , Ghotbzadeh VBD . “ They will do everything in their NN to block it . ” Iranian NNP Abolhassan Bani-Sadr held a similar opinion from his position in Tehran . In a 1992 letter to the NNP task force on the October Surprise NN , Bani - Sadr wrote that he learned of the Republican back - channel initiative in summer 1980 and received a message from an emissary of Ayatollah Ruhollah Khomeini : The Reagan NN was in NN with pro-Republican elements of the NNP in an effort to undermine Carter and wanted Iran ’s NN . Bani-Sadr VBD the emissary “ told me that if I do not accept this proposal they [ the Republicans ] MD VB the same offer to my rivals . ” The emissary added that the Republicans “ have enormous influence in the NNP , ” Bani -Sadr wrote . “ Lastly , he told me my refusal of their offer MD result in my elimination . ” Bani-Sadr VBD he resisted the GOP scheme , but the plan ultimately was accepted by Ayatollah Khomeini , who appeared to have made up his mind IN the NN of Iraq ’s invasion of Iran in mid-September 1980 . However , still sensing a political danger if Carter got the Iranians to VB their minds , the Republicans opened the final full month of the NN by trying to VB Carter ’s hostage talks look IN a cynical ploy to influence the NN ’s outcome . On Oct. 2 , Republican vice - presidential candidate Bush brought up the issue with a group of reporters : “ CD thing that ’s at the back of everybody ’s mind is , ‘ What can Carter do that is so sensational and so flamboyant , if you will , on his side to pull off an October Surprise ? ’ And everybody kind of speculates about it , but there ’s not a darn thing we can do about it , nor is there any strategy we can do except possibly have it discounted . ” CD congressional investigator who was involved in the Iran - Contra and the October Surprise inquiries told me recently that his conclusion was that the Republicans were pursuing every avenue possible to reach the Iranian leadership to VB sure Carter ’s hostage negotiations failed . JJ Israeli intelligence officer Ben-Menashe , in his book and in sworn testimony , VBD the ultimately successful channel was CD involving both JJ and current NNP officers , working with French intelligence for the security of a final meeting in Paris and with Israelis who were given the task of delivering the payoff in weapons shipments and NN to Iran . The key meeting allegedly occurred on the weekend of Oct. 18 - CD , 1980 , between high - level representatives of the Republican NN and the Iranians . Ben -Menashe VBD he was part of a six - member Israeli support delegation for the meeting at the Ritz Hotel in Paris . In his memoir , Ben-Menashe VBD he recognized several Americans , including Republican congressional aide Robert McFarlane and NNP officers Robert NNP ( who had served on Carter ’s NSC staff and was then NNP Director Turner ’s executive assistant ) , Donald Gregg ( another NNP designee to Carter ’s NSC ) and George Cave ( the agency ’s Iran expert ) . Ben -Menashe VBD Iranian cleric Mehdi Karrubi , then a top foreign policy aide to Ayatollah Khomeini , arrived and walked into a conference room . “ A few minutes later George Bush , with the wispy - haired William Casey in front of him , stepped out of the elevator . He smiled , VBD hello to everyone , and , IN Karrubi , hurried into the conference room , ” Ben-Menashe wrote . Ben-Menashe VBD the Paris meetings served to finalize a previously outlined agreement calling for release of the 52 hostages in exchange for $ 52 CD , guarantees of arms NNS for Iran , and unfreezing of Iranian monies in U.S. banks . The timing , however , was changed , he VBD , to coincide with Reagan ’s expected Inauguration on Jan. 20 , 1981 . Though the alleged participants have denied taking part in such a meeting , the alibis cited by the Americans have proved porous . For instance , Gregg produced a photograph of himself in a bathing suit on a beach with the processing date stamped on the back , “ October 1980 . ” There have been others reasons to doubt their innocence . An NNP polygrapher working for Iran - Contra special prosecutor Lawrence Walsh ’s investigation asked Gregg in 1990 , “ were you ever involved in a plan to delay the release of the hostages in Iran until after the 1980 Presidential NN ? ” Gregg ’s negative answer was deemed deceptive . [ VB the Final Report of the Independent Counsel for Iran / Contra Matters , Vol. I , 501 ] Meanwhile , other evidence has surfaced supporting Ben-Menashe ’s testimony . For instance , Chicago Tribune reporter John Maclean , son of author Norman Maclean who wrote A River Runs Through It , confirmed that he was told by a well - placed Republican source on that weekend in October 1980 that Bush was flying to Paris for a clandestine meeting with a delegation of Iranians about the JJ hostages . David Andelman , the biographer for Count Alexandre deMarenches , then head of France ’s Service de Documentation Exterieure NNP de Contre - Espionage ( SDECE ) , testified to the NNP task force that deMarenches told him that he had helped the Reagan - Bush NN arrange meetings with Iranians on the hostage issue in summer and fall of 1980 , with CD meeting in Paris in October . Andelman VBD deMarenches insisted that the secret meetings be kept out of his memoir because the story MD otherwise damage the reputations of his friends , William Casey and George H.W. Bush . The allegations of a Paris meeting RB received support from several other sources , including pilot Heinrich Rupp , who VBD he flew Casey from Washington ’s National Airport to Paris on a flight that left very late on a rainy night in mid-October 1980 . Rupp VBD that after arriving at LeBourget airport outside Paris , he saw a NN resembling Bush on the tarmac . The night of Oct. 18 indeed was rainy in the Washington area . RB , sign - in sheets at the Reagan - Bush headquarters in Arlington , Virginia , placed Casey within a five - minute drive of National Airport late that evening . There were other bits and pieces of corroboration about the Paris meetings . A French arms dealer , Nicholas Ignatiew , told me in 1990 that he had checked with his NN contacts and was told that Republicans did meet with Iranians in Paris in mid-October 1980 . A well - connected French investigative reporter Claude Angeli VBD his sources inside the French secret service confirmed that the service provided “ cover ” for a meeting between Republicans and Iranians in France on the weekend of October 18 - CD . German journalist Martin Kilian had received a similar account from a top aide to intelligence chief deMarenches . As early as 1987 , Iran ’s ex-President Bani-Sadr had made similar claims about a Paris meeting . Finally , a classified report from the Russian NN regarding what its intelligence files showed about the October Surprise issue stated matter - of - factly that Republicans held a series of meetings with Iranians in Europe , including CD in Paris in October 1980 . “ William Casey , in 1980 , met three times with representatives of the Iranian leadership , ” the Russian report VBD . “ The meetings took place in Madrid and Paris . ” At the Paris meeting in October 1980 , “ R[obert ] NNP , at that NN a staffer of the National Security Council in the administration of Jimmy Carter , and JJ NNP Director George Bush RB took part , ” the report VBD . “ In Madrid and Paris , the representatives of Ronald Reagan and the Iranian leadership discussed the question of possibly delaying the release of 52 hostages from the staff of the U.S. Embassy in Teheran . ” ( The Russian report had been requested by Rep. Lee Hamilton , D - Indiana , as part of the 1992 task force investigation of the October Surprise NN . It arrived on Jan. 11 , 1993 , just CD days before the task force was to release its own report rejecting the October Surprise suspicions . Despite the alleged Paris agreement , the Reagan - Bush NN remained nervous about the possibility that Carter might still arrange a pre-election hostage release . The Reagan - Bush NN maintained a 24 - hour Operations Center , which monitored press wires and reports , gave daily press briefings and maintained telephone and telefax contact with the candidate ’s plane , according to a secret draft report of the NNP task force , which added : “ JJ of the staff members were JJ NNP employees who had previously worked on the Bush NN or were otherwise loyal to George Bush . ” Bush and Shackley took personal responsibility for making sure the Republican NN was not caught off guard . According to Richard Allen ’s handwritten notes for Oct. 27 , 1980 , Bush called Allen at 2:12 p.m. as Bush was heading off to VB in Pittsburgh . Bush had gotten an unsettling message from JJ Texas Gov. John Connally , the ex-Democrat who had switched to the Republican Party during the Nixon administration . Connally VBD his NN contacts in the Middle East were buzzing with rumors that Carter had achieved the JJ - elusive breakthrough on the hostages . Bush ordered Allen to find out what he MD about Connally ’s tip . Allen was to pass on any JJ details to CD of Bush ’s aides . According to the notes , Allen was to relay the information to “ Ted Shacklee [ sic ] via Jennifer . ” In a “ secret ” 1992 deposition to the NNP October Surprise task force , Allen VBD the Jennifer was Jennifer Fitzgerald , Bush ’s longtime assistant including during his NN as director of the NNP . Allen testified that “ Shacklee ” was Theodore Shackley , the famous NNP covert operations specialist , the “ blond ghost . ” Yet , despite the last - minute GOP worries , Carter failed to VB the hostages out . The coincidence that the anniversary of the hostage - taking fell on NNP Day 1980 further damaged Carter ’s hopes as Americans were forced to relive the humiliations of the previous NN . Reagan romped to victory in a landslide , winning 44 NNS and bringing with him a Republican Senate . Among the Democrat casualties were key figures in efforts to rein in the powers of the imperial presidency — and of the NNP — including Frank Church of Idaho , Birch Bayh of Indiana and George McGovern of NNP Dakota . In retrospect , some of Carter ’s negotiators felt they should have been much more attentive to the possibility of Republican sabotage . “ Looking back , the Carter administration appears to have been far too trusting and particularly blind to the intrigue swirling IN it , ” VBD JJ NSC official Gary Sick . As the Inauguration neared , Republicans talked tough , making clear that Ronald Reagan MD n’t stand for the humiliation that the nation endured under Jimmy Carter . The Reagan - Bush NN intimated that Reagan MD deal harshly with Iran if it did n’t surrender the hostages . A joke making the rounds of Washington went : “ What ’s three NNS deep and glows in the dark ? Teheran ten minutes after Ronald Reagan becomes NNP . ” On Inauguration Day , Jan. 20 , 1981 , just as Reagan was beginning his inaugural address , word came from Iran that the hostages were freed . The JJ NNS were overjoyed . Privately , some Reagan insiders laughed about their October Surprise success . For instance , Charles Cogan , a high - ranking NNP officer , told the NNP task force in 1992 that he attended a 1981 meeting at NNP headquarters between Casey and CD of David Rockefeller ’s top aides , Joseph V. Reed , who had been appointed to be Ambassador to Morocco . Cogan testified that Reed joked about having blocked Carter ’s hostage release . A task force investigator , who spoke with Cogan in a less formal setting , VBD Reed ’s wording was , “ We fucked Carter ’s October Surprise . ” In the months and the NNS that followed , JJ of the key figures in the October Surprise mystery saw their career paths veer steeply upward . Besides Casey ’s appointment to head the NNP , Gregg became Vice NNP Bush ’s national security adviser . Robert McFarlane later became Reagan ’s NSC adviser . Though relatively JJ , Robert NNP vaulted up the NNP ’s career ladder , becoming head of the analytical division and then deputy director . ( He is now Barack Obama ’s Secretary of Defense . ) As for Israel and Iran , the arms network flowed with weapons to Iran and millions of dollars in profits back to Israel , with some of the NN VBG build JJ settlements in the West Bank . In summer 1981 , this hidden Israeli - Iranian pipeline slipped briefly into JJ view . On July 18 , 1981 , an Israeli - chartered planes was shot down after straying over the Soviet Union . In a PBS interview nearly a decade later , Nicholas Veliotes , Reagan ’s assistant secretary of NN for the Middle East , VBD he looked into the incident by talking to top administration officials who insisted that the NNP Department issue misleading guidance to the press . “ It was clear to me after my conversations with NNS on high that indeed we had agreed that the Israelis MD transship to Iran some JJ - origin JJ equipment , ” Veliotes VBD . In checking out the Israeli flight , Veliotes came to VB that the Reagan camp ’s dealings with Iran dated back to before the 1980 NN . “ It seems to have started in earnest in the period probably prior to the NN of 1980 , as the Israelis had identified who MD become the JJ NNS in the national security area in the Reagan administration , ” Veliotes VBD . “ And I understand some contacts were made at that NN . ” In the mid-1980s , JJ of the same October Surprise actors became figures in the Iran - Contra scandal , another secret arms - for - hostages scheme with Iran that was revealed in late 1986 , despite White NNP denials . According to official Iran- Contra investigations , the plot to sell U.S. weapons to Iran for its NN in freeing JJ hostages then held in Lebanon involved Cyrus Hashemi , John Shaheen , Theodore Shackley , William Casey , Donald Gregg , Robert NNP , Robert McFarlane , George Cave , Ronald Reagan and George H.W. Bush . Yet , RB as the cover -up of the Iran - Contra operations crumbled , key figures in Washington battled to keep the RB more explosive October Surprise suspicions relegated to the loony bin of NN NNS , not to be taken seriously by the JJ NNS . By the NN the October Surprise NN was gaining traction in 1991 , neoconservatives had established themselves as important gatekeepers in the U.S. NN NN . Controversies that threatened to put Israel and Likud in a negative light were hotly contested . So , in fall 1991 , as Congress was deliberating whether to conduct full investigations of the October Surprise issue , Steven Emerson , a journalist with close ties to Likud , produced a cover story for the neoconservative NNP Republic claiming to prove the allegations were a “ myth . ” Almost simultaneously , Newsweek published its own cover story RB attacking the October Surprise allegations . The article , I was told , had been ordered up by executive editor Maynard Parker who was a close associate of Henry Kissinger and was VBN inside Newsweek as a JJ admirer of prominent neocon Elliott Abrams . The CD articles were influential in shaping Washington ’s conventional wisdom , but they were both VBN on a misreading of attendance documents at a London historical conference which William Casey had gone to in July 1980 . The CD publications put Casey at the conference on CD key date — thus supposedly proving he MD not have attended CD of the Madrid meetings with Iranian emissaries . However , after the CD stories appeared , follow - up interviews with conference participants , including historian Robert Dallek , conclusively showed that Casey was n’t there . Veteran journalist Craig Unger , who had worked on the Newsweek cover story , VBD the magazine knew the Casey alibi was bogus but still VBD it . “ It was the most dishonest thing that I ’ve been through in my NN in journalism , ” Unger later told me . Emerson RB was a close friend of Michael Zeldin , the deputy chief counsel for the NNP investigative task force . However , RB as Likud operatives and allies worked to derail any serious investigation , CD top Likud official was more forthcoming . Further , Jimmy Carter is held in disdain by JJ Washington insiders , considered a “ failed NN . ” In other words , the prevailing view is that things worked out just fine in replacing Carter with Reagan no matter how it was done and it makes no sense to rehash any of this unpleasantness . However , there is another NN to read the history : If Carter had freed the hostages and won a second term , the NNP NNPS might have continued on a path toward alternative NN , the federal deficit MD not have soared , and deregulation of corporations MD not have opened the environment and the JJ sector to such dangers . Further , the NNP NNPS might not have embarked on a massive JJ buildup or engaged in the aggressive intelligence operations that went with it . And , Israel might have been pushed into an equitable peace with its Palestinian neighbors three decades RB , rather than pursuing a settlement policy that now makes such an agreement close to impossible . Possibly RB more important , if the sabotaging of Carter ’s reelection in 1980 had failed or at least if it had been exposed in the 1990s , the NNP NNPS might now enjoy a much healthier democracy — VBN on hard truths , not comforting illusions . text: Where is it being played ? Egypt will host the 32nd African Cup of Nations , but that was n't how it was intended to be . Cameroon were named as the host nation back in 2014 . However , failure to provide adequate infrastructure at NN venues , combined with the conflict between French - and English - speakers in the NN , prompted Africa 's CAF NN federation to withdraw Cameroon 's hosting rights in January . The games will take place in four venues split between six stadiums . The capital Cairo boasts three stadiums : the Cairo International Stadium , the NNP Salam Stadium and the June 30 Stadium ( a controversial name referring to the fall of JJ NNP Mohamed Morsi in 2013 ) . The other host cities are Suez , Alexandria and Ismailia . The final will take place in Cairo on CD June at the Cairo International Stadium . Who are the favorites ? It goes without saying that hosts Egypt , boasting Mo Salah in their side , and reigning champions Cameroon belong among the front - runners . But , as usual at this competition , narrowing the field of potential contenders is not easy . Senegal , Morocco , Nigeria and Ghana are just some of the teams with at least a chance of claiming the title . Tanzania 's coach Emmanuel Amunike hit the nail on the head when he warned to write nobody off : " All the teams that are here are good , " the 48 - NN - JJ JJ Sporting and Barcelona striker VBD . The tournament RB includes three NNS that have never made the cut : Burundi , Mauritania and Madagascar . Who are the stars ? With the games being played in Egypt , it 's difficult to look far past Mohammed Salah . Liverpool 's forward MD an international title to his Champions NNP triumph . It MD be Salah 's JJ African Cup of Nations trophy ; Egypt MD lead Africa with seven titles , but they have n't won since 2007 . Liverpool are well represented throughout . Sadio Mane is surely Senegal 's standout star , while Naby Keita will look to drive Guinea 's midfield . The contingent of leading Premier NNP stars is rounded out with Morocco and NNP City winger Riyadh Mahrez . Fans and scouts alike will have their eyes on versatile Ajax attacker Hakim Ziyech , another member of Morocco 's deep squad . Ziyech has been told he 's free to leave , and reportedly dreams of a move to Barcelona or NNP . Several Bundesliga clubs are VBN to have put out feelers regarding the 26 - NN - JJ , the same goes for Inter Milan and AS Roma . Fifteen Bundesliga NNS have made it to the tournament , including Guinea 's Ibrahima Traore ( Borussia Mönchengladbach ) , Senegal 's Salif Sane ( Schalke ) and the Ivory Coast 's Amadou Haidara ( RB Leipzig ) . What else is JJ ? For the JJ NN , the competition is being played in the northern hemisphere 's summer . In the past it took place in January and February , meaning that the star NNS at JJ clubs MD miss an important phase of the domestic NN . This scheduling fits the JJ teams better , but the higher temperatures MD prove an extra burden on NNS already fatigued by a JJ NN . And , as in so JJ international competitions of late , expansion 's the name of the NN . For the JJ NN , 24 teams rather than 16 will take part — following in the footsteps of Euro 2018 and the NNP 's NNP Cup . The upshot 's the same at the other competitions : very few teams will drop out in the group phase . Instead of CD progressing from each group , now the top CD from each of the six groups plus the four best - performing third - placed finishers will advance to the JJ knockout round of 16 .

text: Have you ever experienced a " NN failure " ? That is , have you ever turned on your faucet and VBN that no NN came out of it ? If you VBP your NN from a municipal NN NN , the answer is probably " no . " We have NN failures all the NN . Cable TV goes out fairly frequently . Although less common , the phone NN goes down every so often , and it is now common to VB an " all circuits busy " message when making JJ - distance calls . But the NN in any city or suburb is always there . NN pressure is very reliable . A JJ reason for that level of reliability is the NN tower . You VBP NN towers everywhere , especially if you live in a JJ area full of small towns . Each NN NN has CD or more towers . In this article , we will look at how NN towers work . The next NN you drive by a NN tower , you will VB exactly what it is doing . A NN tower is an incredibly simple device . Although NN towers come in all shapes and sizes , they all do the same thing : A NN tower is simply a JJ , elevated tank of NN . For example , take the NN tower shown at the NN . This tower is located in Kill Devils Hill , near Kitty Hawk , NC . It is about 165 NNS ( 50 meters ) tall . NN towers are tall to provide pressure . Each NN of height provides 0.43 PSI ( pounds IN square Inch ) of pressure . A typical municipal NN supply runs at between 50 and 100 PSI ( major appliances require at least 20 to 30 PSI ) . The NN tower must be tall enough to supply that level of pressure to all of the houses and businesses in the area of the tower . So NN towers are typically located on high ground , and they are tall enough to provide the necessary pressure . In hilly regions , a tower can sometimes be replaced by a simple tank located on the highest hill in the area . A NN tower 's tank is normally quite JJ . A normal in - ground swimming pool in someone 's backyard might hold something IN 20,000 or 30,000 gallons ( that 's a lot of NN ! ) , and a typical NN tower might hold 50 times that amount ! text: Plans announced by the German NN last month to vaccinate 25 CD NNS against swine NN this autumn are increasingly coming under attack . Berlin has VBN the NN insurance NNS must bear the costs , while they , in turn , have threatened to raise their premiums or impose a surcharge on patients . The Federal Association of Local Authorities ( DSTGB ) insists its members should not have to pay for the vaccinations . The benefits of such a massive program have not been adequately substantiated , according to Professor Gerd Glaeske , who researches pharmaceutical applications at the Center for NNP Politics at the NNP of Bremen . “ Vaccinations are not a panacea , ” Glaeske VBD . Some critics RB suggest that much of the hysteria over a possible swine NN epidemic has been artificially created . They point to the very limited number of swine NN infections in Germany , none of which have been fatal . “ This is huge business for the pharmaceutical industry , ” VBD NNP Democrat deputy , Wolfgang Wodarg . It 's ridiculous , ” he added . The NN plan , so far The German NNP Ministry late last month announced a draft plan outlining who will be immunized RB . The DSTGB fears being overwhelmed with the task . It VBZ the NN 's draft NN plan has not been carefully thought through and warns of confusion due to a poor allocation of responsibilities . It has called for local NN authorities , doctors and clinics to be urgently informed of the NN 's specific plans . A spokeswoman for the German NNP Ministry VBD NN agreements will be finalized with Germany 's 16 federal NNS over the next few weeks . Meanwhile , pharmaceutical NNS , including Sanofi Pasteur , Novartis and CSL are producing the NN at top speed .
